text: What two-dimensional shapes and three-dimensional figures can be created by slicing a rectangular prism in various directions?

Two dimensional shapes: triangles, rectangles, trapezoids.

Three dimensional shapes: triangular prisms, rectangular prisms, trapezoidal prisms.

Did You Know?

We can ‘slice’ a cube with a laser light to see the 2-dimesional cross sections.

PBS Video filmed at the National Museum of Mathematics (time 1:26 minutes)
